com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction

Class AbstractTransactionDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDaoDelegate<S>
      • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDataDelegate<BsTransaction,ITransaction,com.poesys.db.pk.SequencePrimaryKey>
        • com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.AbstractTransactionDelegate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.poesys.bs.delegate.IDataDelegate<BsTransaction,ITransaction,com.poesys.db.pk.SequencePrimaryKey>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionDelegate

    public abstract class AbstractTransactionDelegate
extends com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDataDelegate<BsTransaction,ITransaction,com.poesys.db.pk.SequencePrimaryKey>

    A business delegate that provides an application programming interface for Transaction objects and their dependents. You should not modify this class; instead, override or add methods in the class TransactionDelegate, which specializes this class.

    An exchange of value between accounts; the items that correspond to the fiscal year accounts must balance (cancel each other out with respect to debits and credits)

    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge
    See Also:
    TransactionDelegate

      • createTransaction

        public BsTransaction createTransaction(java.math.BigInteger transactionId,
                                       java.lang.String description,
                                       java.sql.Timestamp transactionDate,
                                       java.lang.Boolean checked,
                                       java.lang.Boolean balance)
                                throws com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException

        Create a new Transaction with data fields.

        The Transaction class has a sequence key; this method generates the sequence for later insertion into the database.

        Parameters:
        transactionId - primary key attribute
        description - a text describing the nature of the transaction
        transactionDate - the calendar day on which the transaction occurred
        checked - whether the transaction is reconciled and validated
        balance - whether the transaction represents a balance transaction, the transfer of an amount onto the balance sheet; balance transactions do not need to have off-setting debits and credits and are ignored in balance checking for normal transactions
        Returns:
        the new Transaction object
        Throws:
        com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException - when there is a problem generating the key or creating the object

      • createReimbursement

        public BsReimbursement createReimbursement(BsItem receivablesObject,
                                           BsItem reimbursingItemsObject,
                                           java.lang.Integer receivablesOrderNumber,
                                           java.lang.Integer reimbursingItemsOrderNumber,
                                           java.math.BigInteger receivablesTransactionId,
                                           java.math.BigInteger reimbursingItemsTransactionId,
                                           java.lang.Double reimbursedAmount,
                                           java.lang.Double allocatedAmount)
                                    throws com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException
        Create a new Reimbursement association class child of Transaction with an association key. This class links the input objects.
        Parameters:
        receivablesObject - associated Item object (part of the key)
        reimbursingItemsObject - associated Item object (part of the key)
        receivablesOrderNumber - Attribute that is part of the association key
        reimbursingItemsOrderNumber - Attribute that is part of the association key
        receivablesTransactionId - Attribute that is part of the association key
        reimbursingItemsTransactionId - Attribute that is part of the association key
        reimbursedAmount - the amount of the receivable item amount that is reimbursed by the reimbursement item (must be less than or equal to the reimbursement amount)
        allocatedAmount - dollar amount not reimbursed by any reimbursement item; this "writes off" the allocated amount when summing up amounts applied against the receivable
        Returns:
        a new Reimbursement business layer DTO
        Throws:
        com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException - when a parameter causes a problem

      • createItem

        public BsItem createItem(BsTransaction parent,
                         java.math.BigInteger transactionId,
                         java.lang.Integer orderNumber,
                         java.lang.Double amount,
                         java.lang.Boolean debit,
                         java.lang.Boolean checked,
                         java.lang.String accountName,
                         java.lang.String entityName)
                  throws com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException
        Create a new Item child of Transaction with a composite key.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent of the child object to create
        transactionId - composite super-key attribute that uniquely identifies child combined with child sub-key and any other parent super-keys
        orderNumber -
        amount - the monetary amount in dollars of the transaction item
        debit - whether the item is a debit (true) or credit (false); default value is the debit-default value of the account
        checked - whether the value and details of the transaction item have been verified and reconciled
        accountName - foreign key used by setter to query associated object
        entityName - foreign key used by setter to query associated object
        Returns:
        a new Item business layer DTO
        Throws:
        com.poesys.bs.delegate.DelegateException - when a parameter causes a problem
